attributes.action: introduce legislation amending the Racial and Religious Hatred Act 2006 to provide clarification that expressed hatred or non-violent attack on a particular religion does not constitute hatred of a person or group of people
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Racial and Religious Hatred Act 2006 rightly gives protection against threatening language for minority groups.
It is, however, likely that the Act could be used to silence legitimate religious teaching (including, but not exclusively, the views held by Christians, Muslims and Atheists).
This petition is intended to call for protection for religious groups to express their non-violent views freely without fear of prosecution.
